inn1.comm: gentle outswing outside off, the batsman pushes it to wide mid-off to get off the mark
zips this one in but it swings down the leg side
corrects the radar and fires it in the middle stump line, the batsman defends it to the leg side
no room given as this swings in from outside off, Hughes defends it down the pitch
floats this one further up but just a little too straight, easily clipped it to fine leg off the pads
he waits on the back foot and defends this length delivery to the off side. Not much bounce there
stays in the crease and defends the back of length delivery solidly to off
just marginally short of length and Hughes shuffles across and whips it off his hips through backward square leg..
this is fuller from Morkel and just outside off, Hughes comes forward and defends
this is a wild one, too far away on the off and the movement takes it almost to the first slip
length delivery on the stumps, Hughes defends it off the back foot to midwicket
another pull! this is through wide mid-on and it teases Phangiso all the way to the boundary. It wasn't that short but Hughes quickly rocks back and flat-bats it in front of square
length delivery outside off, he steers it to third man to turn the strike over
first big shot! Finch leans into this length delivery and chips it over midwicket.. not much timing but it takes the ball comfortably over the infield
swings this into the pads, Hughes shapes for the flick but gets rapped on the pads
bowls in the channel just outside off, the batsman doesn't have any room, has to defend it down the pitch
gives some width outside off and Hughes punches it on the up through cover.. The lack of swing aiding his composure as he places it in the gap
superbly hit through extra cover! Finch trusts the bounce, watches the swing and just punches it beautifully through off.. that races away. That's one pretty shot there
stands tall again and punches the back of length delivery to point
targets the off stump with a skiddy delivery, the batsman defends it to the off side
he shapes to pull but this doesn't get up much, takes the bottom edge and rears towards the vulnerable regions
he stands tall and punches the length delivery to the off side
gets low at the crease as he cuts this back of length delivery to third man
he stays back and chops the back of length delivery towards the slip cordon. Only Amla placed there
drifts on to the pads and Finch misses out a flick, it grazes the pads and rolls to the leg side
arches back and chops down the short of length delivery to third man

first wicket! This has been smashed to short cover. Steyn pitched it up outside off and Hughes made such good connection the reverberation of that shot would have been felt in Melbourne.. but he punches it straight into the hands of the fielder.. A stinger made look easy
fuller and on the off and middle line, the batsman tucks it to midwicket
drifting on to the pads and Smith flicks it to fine leg for a single
length delivery on off, the batsman stays back and punches it down the pitch
this is easily chipped over wide mid-on for a boundary.. Steyn is floating them up striving for the big outswing, but there isn't any, easy pickings
back of length just outside off, defended to  cover
he clips this angled delivery down to fine leg. The shortness in length allowing the batsman time to work his shot out
smart work at third man, Parnell there, which keeps the batsmen to just a single. It was a late cut that was running quickly towards the boundary
length delivery on off, the batsman defends it down the pitch
shuffles across, the batsman whips it across to the leg side, straight to square leg
slower ball from Morkel! You don't see them often.. Smith plays for it much earlier without moving his feet and is comprehensively beaten
smartly punched down the ground! He stands tall to this shortish one, and while normally a batsman would go square with the shot, Smith goes down the ground.. beats mid-off
fires a yorker on off stump, the batsman digs it out down the pitch
cracking drive! Parnell serves up a juicy half-volley and it is drilled past the bowler at scorching pace
back of length now, the batsman has to hop around and he nudges it to midwicket for a single
he flicks it in the air from outside off, it just lands short of Miller at mid-on. A hair-raising moment for the batsman.. Parnell's are already raised
he waits on the back foot and cracks the short and wide delivery through backward point.  A loose delivery there
angled across the right-hander, who leaves this one alone
he moves to the leg side to give himself room and drills it through off, but straight to short cover
pushed through on off, the batsman chops it down to short third man
looks to force it away through backward point but cannot beat the fielder
comes down the pitch but almost yorks himself, gets an inside edge on to his pads
slower this time, the batsman wanted to nudge it to the leg side but gets a leading edge down the pitch
he is finally able to get it through! Handsome inside-out drive over the infield. He was trying to score six boundaries in this over.. but he gets the first one off the sixth ball
fires it on a length around off stump, Smith defends it down the pitch
shuffles across and pushes the length delivery down the pitch towards mid-off
length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and defends it towards point
this one fizzes past the outside edge as the batsman tries to steer it to third man. That took off from the pitch

they are struggling a bit now! This is a nothing pull and the top-edge lobs up towards the non-striker end where Miller, running in from mid-on, takes an easy one. It was the effort ball, got a bit big on Smith and his bottom hand came off the handle ..
angles it across the right-hander, who lets it go through. Excellent over from Parnell, a wicket maiden
uses his feet and pushes the fuller delivery to wide mid-on for a single. Morkel has to dive to his right to stop that.. rolls on that injured shoulder
pushed through on off, the batsman nudges it to midwicket off the back foot
tossed up on off, the batsman dabs it to midwicket for a single
much slower on off, the batsman punches it to cover off the back foot
takes a step out of the crease and defends it down the pitch
goes deep in the crease and defends this flatter delivery to the leg side
back of length delivery on off, easily defended to the off side
loud appeal for caught behind, De Kock is jumping up and about in celebration.. this one cut back in to the batsman and flicked the top of the pad en route to the keeper

another appeal for caught behind as this one passes the outside edge as Finch misses the cut shot! But I heard a sound there. Parnell is gobsmacked by that call. Loud noise as the ball passes the bat.. Has to be the bat.. No wonder Parnell is miffed. De Kock was excited too. Tiffin, the umpire, doesn't budge
length delivery on the stump, the batsman defends it to mid-on
this is a good over.. surprises the batsman with a sharp bouncer but it sails over the batsman and the keeper
bowls it a touch slower this time, the batsman plays it to mid-on with soft hands and calls for a quick single
crashes this widish delivery in front of point but cannot beat the fielder
short and wide, spinning away from the batsman, the batsman is not able to get timing as he shapes to cut.. chops it to point
here's the turn! That fizzes past the forward defensive poke
now he plays for the turn and there isn't any, gets a thick inside edge past the leg stump for a run down to fine leg
flatter and shorter, turns away and squares up the batsman who was looking to come down, defended to point
he goes deep in the crease and works it away to deep extra cover for a single
takes a step down the pitch and smothers the spin with a dead bat
he keeps it tight around off stump, Finch defends it to point
another appeal, this one is for lbw.. But this one pitched outside leg and was probably going over.. The batsmen take a leg bye to the off side
superb delivery! This one jags away from the batsman after pitching.. was the cutter actually. Beats the outside edge
fuller and wider outside off, easy pickings as Bailey drives it to deep extra cover
back of length on the pads, he nudges it to midwicket for a single but a poor throw allows an extra run
walks way down the pitch to work this shortish delivery to the leg side but gets hit high on the pads
tossed up outside off, the batsman drives it to wide long off for a single
he looks to punch this through off, but chops it towards point
comes down the pitch to push it to the leg side but plays outside the line, gets hit on the pads
lunges forward and defends the slower delivery to the off side
stays solidly behind the line of this one, defends it to off
he pushes it to the gap at cover off the back foot
poor start, this is short and down the leg side, pulled down to fine leg for a single
tossed up outside off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to cover
wooo that was close! The batsman makes room to cut it through off but it doesn't bounce much.. he underedges it close to his boot.. That could have gone anywhere.. by which I mean towards the stumps
comes out of the crease and yorks himself
looks to cut again, but this skids on.. he ends up chopping to off
tossed up and much slower, the batsman waits and cuts it late, but straight to short third man
he comes out of the pitch and drives this to off, but cannot beat cover
much slower this time, the batsman waits and punches it to deep cover
he waits on the back foot and cuts it behind point for a couple to move to 999 ODI runs
that's a grand for Finch as he punches this to deep cover for a single
back of length, cut straight to point
tossed up this time, the batsman comes forward and defends
he plays the fuller delivery from the crease, wrists it to point
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and defends
superb delivery! Bailey didn't read that googly at all. He was shaping for cut and surprises the batsman, it gets a bottom edge to the leg side
fuller and quicker on the pads, the batsman punches it down to long on
lots of air on this one, Finch drills it down to long off
full and flighted on the stumps, the batsman defends it to midwicket
tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman punches it to deep cover for a single
takes a step out and pushes it towards cover, wants a single but is rightly sent back
much slower from Phangiso, the batsman comes forward and defends it to off
he comes out of the crease and gets to the pitch of the delivery, drives it to long off
he gets a touch cramped as Phangiso bowls it on pads after the batsman has charged down, gets an inside edge to short fine leg and takes a single
short delivery, this is pulled firmly to deep backward square leg
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman pushes it back down the pitch
appeal for lbw as the batsman pushes outside the line and gets hit on the pads.. good shout there.. probably going over middle
slides this one in a touch quicker, the batsman punches it  to cover
dabs it fine to short third man for a quick single
fuller on off, Finch punches it down the ground firmly, to long-on
that's the googly again! Tahir buzz lightyears to infinity and beyond in celebration.. Last over, Bailey didn't pick one. He doesn't pick this one either but chops this on to his stumps
oh he launches this back of length delivery over cover, a strange shot to play when there is a fielder in the deep.. It just lands short of the fielder.. Finch thought he had holed out
short delivery first up, the batsman ducks under it
back of length delivery on the body, the batsman is off the mark with a clip to fine leg
fuller outside off, the batsman punches it on the up to deep extra cover for a single
fuller delivery outside off, Marsh drives it straight to cover
this one gets big on the batsman but he manages to steer it down to third man
tossed up on off, the batsman comes forward and defends it to extra cover
flatter and quicker outside off, the batsman dabs it to short third man for a quick single
fuller and flighted, the batsman punches it down to long off for a single
tossed up outside off, the batsman pushes it to cover
lots of air on this one, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
quicker delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it to off
back of length delivery on the stumps, defended to midwicket off the back foot
good job by Miller at mid-on to stop that! That was punched in the air past the bowler's right hand.. and was running away.. it got a bad bounce too but Miller was keeping a solid eye on it.
bouncer outside off, the batsman drops his wrists
another bouncer attempted but this has room outside off, Marsh climbs on to that and whacks it through midwicket with a powerful pull
he waits on the back foot and guides this one to third man for a single
big outside edge  as the batsman looks for a drive but there is no one in the slips. Tahir slides across from third man to prevent the boundary
tossed up much slower, the batsman comes forward and defends
now this one is fired on the toes, the batsman manages to clip it fine on the leg side for three
googly again, but this is short enough for the batsman to pick, pushed to long on for single
tossed up outside off, Finch wants drill it through cover but gets an inside edge to short fine leg
this is flighted too full, the batsman takes it on the full and whips it over midwicket for a boundary. It brings up team's 100
driven firmly off the front foot but Faf dives at short cover to stop a certain boundary
length delivery outside off, it's bowled a touch slower, the batsman misses the cut and is beaten
another one past the outside edge as Finch looks to hit out over cover
three in a row! There has been enough width on each of these deliveries, but Finch's feet are stuck to the crease.. misses out on a cut shot
back of length outside off, the batsman punches it to cover off the back foot
superb delivery! This one angles in and then straightens to fizz past the outside edge.. That is the fourth one in the over that has misses the edge
he pushes it in the air through cover point to bring up his half-century to bring up his fourth fifty..
back of length on top of off, the batsman chops it to backward point for a quick single
length delivery on off, he comes forward and defends it comfortably to cover point
wanted to play a bit across the line to this short of length delivery and gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman jams the bat down to defend it to mid-on
quicker delivery raps the batsman on the pads. Finch is stuck in the crease but this one is sliding down the leg side
another one hits the pads but this one is slipping down the leg side too
tossed up on off, the batsman defends to off
flatter this time, turns away but is comfortably punched down to long off
he goes back and pushes it to cover
slower and tossed up, Finch chops it to backward point
cramps him for room with a leg-stump line, Finch punches it down to long on
he waits on the back foot and whips it behind square on the leg side for a single
back of length on off stump, Marsh glides it down to third man for a single
he stays in the crease and punches it past cover point for a single
fuller delivery on off, Mitchell comes solidly behind it and defends it back to Steyn
he misses out on a flick on this leg side-ish delivery, picks up a leg bye to square leg
he can't seem to put bat properly on ball, gets a thick inside edge on to his pads
stays in the crease and defends the length delivery to cover.. He is a little annoyed with his current struggle to get the balls away
he looks to punch it through off, but gets a thick inside edge to square leg
opens his stance to play it to the off side but pushes it straight to point
still no respite! He comes down the pitch and plays down the wrong line, gets hit on the pads
gets some inside edge to short fine leg as he looks to work this away to the leg side
finally gets one off the middle, a flick to deep midwicket takes him off strike
tossed up on the stumps, driven towards the non-striker where Phangiso fields

Finch goes extinct! The theory of evolution would tell you that Finch was a bit uncomfortable in the environment and was not going to last long. (Maybe there will be new improved version soon). This one jags back in from Steyn and takes out the middle as the batsman pushes limply outside the line, leaving a gap between bat and pad. Excellent delivery

this is gone! Maxwell can't solve this equation.. Steyn has been reversing it in in the second spell and this time he traps him on the back foot.. Maxwell was stuck in the crease and plays outside the line.. The umpire raises the finger
he watches it carefully and keeps it out to cover.. This one was on a length and didn't come back..
wobbles a bit outside off, Haddin is not very sure if he wants to go forward or back, and pushes at it from the crease, defends to point
this one swings away but it's too wide, easily left alone
he leaves this alone but I am not sure if he knew how close it was, it goes zipping past the off stump..Steyn smiles
short and quick on the stumps, Marsh punches it back to the bowler
lunges forward and defends the flatter delivery down the pitch
he goes deep and wrists away the googly to deep midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, Haddin comes forward and defends
drifting on to the pads, the batsman nudges it to short fine leg for a quick sone
this spins the conventional way, Marsh punches it to deep cover for a single
short delivery, stops on the surface and messes the batsman's pull shot, he takes the hit on his shoulder
back of length on the stumps, the batsman dabs it to square leg for a single
he hops around in the crease and defends this short of length delivery to the off side
he clips it off his hips towards midwicket for a quick single
he waits for this cutter and steers it down to third man for a single
back of length outside off, the batsman defends it to backward point
quicker and on the stumps, the batsman drives it through mid-off
slides this one in, the batsman defends it down the pitch
he comes forward and defends it to off
he waits on the back foot and punches it down to long off for a single
bowls the googly, the batsman comes forward and gets an inside edge on to his pads
slides this one in, the batsman defends it to the off side
bowls it full, possibly looking for the reverse, the batsman digs it out through point
shorter on off now, the batsman cannot get it away, chops it close to his boots
fuller delivery on the stumps, the batsman punches it through to mid-off.. This was shaping away from the batsman.. Amla waiting at first slip
he comes forward and punches the length ball down to mid-on
looks for the pull but gets a bottom edge to the off side.. Faf comes flying from point and hits the stumps at the striker's end, Haddin was in through
now that's what we are talking about! Fuller delivery, swerves away late and opens up the batsman completely.. Haddin doesn't have a clue..
flatter and turning away, the batsman defends but the ball rolls back close to his off stump
he has had enough! He takes a tiny step down the pitch and hammers the flighted delivery over the sight screen...out of the ground.. He has cleared the four-storey building there
quicker delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
he nudges it to the leg side but straight to backward square leg
high full toss this time, the batsman punches it to long on for a single.
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it to mid on
length delivery angled across the right-hander, the batsman pushes it straight to point
now Marsh is sent packing! This one is on a length - pretty straight forward delivery - and Marsh pushes at it a bit tentatively.. It gets a thick inside edge and knocks the middle stump back
swings it away from a short of length, squares up the batsman, it flies past the outside edge
he gets off the mark with a quick single to mid-on, could have been in trouble had this hit
he waits on the back foot and defends this length delivery to the off side
tossed up and slower, the batsman comes forward and defends
drifting on to the pads, the batsman dabs it to midwicket for a single
he goes back in the crease and defends the floated delivery to midwicket

dropped, by AB? yes, you don't see that often. The batsman went for a cross-batted slog and hit it straight to him at midwicket - a simple chest-high chance -  but he can't close his palms around that. He took a stinger to dismissed Hughes
comes forward and pushes this softly to cover for a single
they pick up another single to the off side with a calm dab

you can't keep him away! This one is fired in to the stumps and Haddin gets smacked on the back pad.. that was hitting middle and leg. Not massive reverse, but it just tails in enough to get a wicket.. At his pace, it's always a tricky delivery to play
angled across the batsman, who stays in the crease as he tries to defend this fuller delivery, it whistles past the outside edge
outside edge this time, this flies flat to third man
fuller delivery on off stump, Faulkner watches it carefully and defends
fuller outside off, Faulkner comes forward and pushes it of mid-off
length delivery on off, the batsman is wary of those inswingers, but this one comes in straight, defended to cover
angled across the left-hander, Johnson shoulders arms
squares up the batsman with a length delivery, Johnson gets an outside edge down to third man
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it to the off side
he comes forward and pushes it past the diving cover point fielder for a single to the deep
clean swish of the bat! This was fuller and Johnson moves to the leg side, making just enough room to hammer it over mid-off

superb catch at the boundary from Phangiso! To be fair to Johnson, he got a good amount of bat on that.. he flicked it off the middle stump and this would have been a six on some grounds.. but this is a long boundary.. Phangiso, at deep square leg, has to back-pedal and manages to hold on as the ball threatens to go over his shoulder
this one slides past the outside edge as the batsman looks to drive.. called a wide, a tad harshly
angles this one away from the left-hander, Starc leaves it alone
comes forward and defends the length delivery to the off side
swing and a miss, the batsman wants to go downtown with that shot but it zips past the outside edge
this one swings back in to the left-hander, who leaves it alone thinking it was going away, just misses the off stump
he clips this length delivery off his pads, cannot beat the man at square leg
length delivery on off, the batsman punches it to cover
length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and defends it to the leg side
he leans into this fuller delivery and drives it comfortably to deep cover
he punches this on the up to pick up a single to mid off
angled in to the right-hander, the batsman defends it off the back foot.. He has overstepped though
it's a slower bouncer, Faulkner drags it to deep midwicket with a laboured pull
length delivery on the stumps, Starc comes forward and defends
back of length outside off, the batsman defends it to the off side and a misfield allows one run. Australia touch the 150 marker
that is quick! It swings away and fizzes past the outside edge
another one slides past the outside edge. Starc is not holding back his drives, but he is sitting on the passenger seat at the moment
slightly short of length, the batsman defends it to the off side
short ball outside off, Starch is a little late on the shot and underedges it to the keeper
he pushes this into the covers to get to the other end
he fires a fuller delivery on the stumps, Faulkner can only push it to mid-off. No respite
long hop on the stumps but Starc is in survival mode, defends it down the pitch
he leans forward and drives the tossed up delivery down to long off
sees the googly early and nudges it to short fine leg, but the fielder charges in and prevents the single
he dabs it through midwicket for a single to the deep
he bowls the googly but this is too full, allows the batsman to cover the spin, and kill it, bury it in the pitch
bowls the slider on off, the batsman nudges it through square leg for a single
length delivery outside off, the batsman leaves it alone. There was a hint of inward movement on that
short and wide, easily steered through backward point for a couple of runs to third man
there is enough width this time, Starc crashes it to deep cover for a single
they want a quick single to cover point, but Faulkner has to turn back as Faf charges in from point.. The throw is not being backed up, and they get the single anyway
sharp bouncer! Starc was getting sucked into it but gets his head out of the way right at the last moment
length delivery wide outside off, punched on the up to deep cover
driven in the air but just lands short of Duminy at cover
quicker delivery on the stumps, the batsman defended down the pitch
it's the googles..spins the other way, beating the outside edge
long handle comes handy! Starc gets under this flighted delivery and smashes it over the cow corner
swings across the line but this is not full enough, bounces over his bat and hits the keeper on the chest
full and quick outside off, the batsman slices it to deep point for a single
length delivery outside off, the batsman can only slice it to point
he comes forward to defend but punches this in the air almost all the way to mid off
he looks to push this through point but cannot beat the fielder
looks to cut this down to third man but plays inside the line, beaten
he comes forward and pulls this off the front foot to deep midwicket for a couple. Not much pace from Parnell there, easily dealt with
bouncer down the leg side, but Russell Tiffin lets the bowler off the hook, he thinks it's fine
how has he survived that one! That spun in from outside off and hit the batsman who was stuck on the crease.. was it turning down leg? Maybe
flatter delivery on the stumps, the batsman dabs it to the leg side for a single
sliding down the leg side but the batsman paddles it to short fine leg
fuller delivery on the stumps, the batsman digs it out to the off
useful hitting! Starc is being the thorn for South Africa here, swings hard and clears the rope over long on.. Australia are making something out of this
looks to hit across the line, the batsman gets hit on the pads
fires it full on the stumps, the batsman flicks it through midwicket for a single
nearly a catch at slip! But that travelled quickly to him and was going over.. Faulkner makes room and flashes hard, Amla does well to get a hand to it actually
makes room and swings down the line, makes no connection though

Whoaa.. Fa U L K N E R!! He goes long.. Charges down the pitch, Steyn chases him but he still swings across the line and clears the rope at cow corner.. only just.. but Australia are loving these late hits. The umpires want to be sure if that cleared the ropes.. it's given a four
second boundary now! Faulkner is turning it on, he moves to the leg side and drills this fuller delivery through extra cover for four more
fired on the blockhole, the batsman digs it out to the leg side for a quick single
sharp bouncer, the batsman pulls it without timing to vacant wide mid-on and they get back for a couple.. It was off the toe of the bat
he has cleared the mid-off fielder! Faulkner was saving himself for this assault, makes room and slices it over the infield.. Not much timing, but that would do
he comes forward and wallop's this length delivery to the cow corner for a couple of runs
he sees the batsman charging and pushes it wide, a bit too wide..
gets a high full toss which he outside edge down to third man! The bowler is lucky, that could have gone anywhere.. Faulkner was intent on sending it outside the ground
looks to pull but this is a slower bouncer! That hits the batsman's rib cage.

this beats everyone! It was a good slower ball and beats the batsman's swing, but it drops short of de Kock, who is not able to bring his body behind it. Australia breach the 200-mark. Excellent stuff from these two
bowls on the pads as the batsman tries to make room, but Faulkner smartly flicks it through backward square leg
good slower delivery this one! The batsman reaches out as this is wide, but can only underedge it to the keeper
bowls a sharp bouncer now! Faulkner fends it in the air down the pitch.. a few meters away from Parnell. The bowler gets to the ball and fires a throw at the non-striker's
he makes room and punches it to extra cover for a single
he clears his front leg and hammers the short delivery over extra cover for three runs to the deep. These runs are hurting SA

down the leg side and Faulkner just has to get some bat on it, he flicks it past the short fine leg fielder for yet another boundary. Parnell was expecting him to make room, but Faulkner was still this time
slower delivery, the batsman swings his bat but meets thin air

he gets cramped for room as Morkel targets the ribs, the batsman takes off for a single. Morne gets to the ball and wants to hit the stumps, but holds it back. Starc was in the way and Morkel has been wary of throwing all day
fires it in the blockhole but the batsmen take a couple to long off, that was hit straight down the ground
he moves to the leg side to hit it over the top but Faulkner has holed out at long on
he shuffles across to the off side and drags the length ball to wide long on for a couple
swing and a miss, but Australia have done well

inn2.comm: gets some inward shape outside off, the batsman punches it to cover off the front foot
quicker delivery outside off, the batsman allows it to go through.. That had some zip in it
targets the body with a short one, Amla sways away from the line
looks to punch this fuller delivery through off without getting his feet forward, ends up inside edging it to mid-on
this is beautifully punched down the ground for a boundary! Johnson is serving them full and rightly so, but Amla brings his bat down in time and punches it straight past the non-striker
looks to drive it through cover, but doesn't get much timing, pushes it to mid-off
pushed through on off stump, the batsman defends it down the pitch
much slower but wider outside off, the batsman comes forward and punches it through point for a couple of runs
outside edge! QdK is lured into a booming drive but gets a thick outside edge wide of the lone slip, it runs down to the boundary
fuller on the stumps, he comes forward and eases it down to long off
quicker delivery on the stumps, Amla nudges it past midwicket for a single
lots of air on off stump, the batsman pushes it to cover
he stands tall and punches this length delivery through wide mid-off for a couple of runs, it looks just like a defensive push, but it is aimed at the gap
not much feet movement, but Amla drives it with a lot of timing, straight to the fielder at mid-off though
pushes this one wide outside off, it's just inside the marker. The umpire gives it a good look but decides against calling it a wide
he comes forward and punches the length delivery down to mid-off
he walks way over to the off side and drives the fuller delivery with a lot of timing, finds the man at cover.. He exposed all three stumps there..
looks to pull one that is not short enough, it grazes the thigh pad before rolling to the second slip fielder
full toss is eased towards cover, should have found the gap there

he would have loved to found the gap this time, Quinton de Kock has fallen early once more,  he skips over near the pitch of the ball and looks to clobber the ball over the leg side, a leading edge sends the ball looping towards Bailey at cover, Maxwell gets de Kock again
full ball outside off, Amla is his usual elegant self, pushes that past cover for three
the man in form, Faf du Plessis, drives this back towards the bowler
outside off and that is left alone
eased towards long-on for a single
thick outside edge there, Australia need this wicket early, bounces short and wide of a diving Steve Smith in the cordon
left alone outside off
mistimed drive back towards the bowler
short of length ball, Amla jumps to get on top of the bounce of that one, guides the ball towards third man, nicely done by Amla there
pitched up and that is driven towards mid-off, Johnson has his hands on his head as though he was expecting a wicket there, but Faf pretty much middled it
full and outside off, Faf watches it through to the keeper
width on offer, Amla slashes the ball towards cover, Smith dives but he can't make a clean stop
outside off from Mitchell Marsh, Amla happy to leave
on a length and heading for off stump, defended down the track
Marsh gets the outside edge, Amla not in control as he looksto push down the ground, the ball stays low though and goes past backward point
defended down the track by Faf
what a hit from Faf, makes a touch of room and punches that back of a length ball through cover for four, played that on the up, well wide of the fielder
Mitch Starc takes over from Mitch Johnson, his first ball is defended down the track
full and a touch of width, Amla pounces on that one, lashing it through cover, but the timing is not there, the ball slows down near the rope and the batsmen take three
defended towards the off side by Faf
driven towards cover by Faf, he can't place it in the gap though
fires this down the leg side, he will have to re-bowl this one
defends this one to the off side

full and on middle stump, dug out towards mid-on, that was a very tight single, 'yes, yes, yes' Faf called after playing the shot, Amla responded immediately, else he would have been caught short by that direct hit, they ponder taking an overthrow but there isn't time
full ball outside off, defended solidly to the off side
Marsh drops it short, he doesn't have the pace to drop it short, especially against Faf in this form, Faf swats this to the square-leg boundary

this time it is fuller, but still Faf gets three as he launches this over the off side, skips down the track and sends it over cover, can't time it properly so the fielder can drag it back as it nears the rope
full and on the pads, clipped towards deep square-leg for two more, South Africa scoring plenty
pitched up and on the pads, nudged towards deep midwicket
tuck towards midwicket for one more, 11 off the over, too many leg-side deliveries from Marsh there
steers this one towards third man for an ambled single
Amla surprised as the ball cuts away from Starc, Amla ends up playing inside the line as he looks to drive through off
middles it this time, a pitched-up delivery is crisply struck towards cover, but straight at cover

top cricket this, short ball at the body, superbly directed, Amla arched his back seemingly wanting to get out of the way initially, but he has the time to just dab this one towards third man for four, a diving Marsh can't cut it off
tapped towards square leg this time
full and on the stump, defended to the off side
balls stays a touch lower than Amla expects, he has to adjust late, the ball was moving away a bit as well, Amla opens the face as he defends towards cover
length ball heading for off stump, blocked back down the track
a touch shorter, keeps it tight around off stump, Amla blocks this to the off side

big lbw shout but that was definitely too high and possibly heading down the leg side, 
Amla was looking to work this length ball towards square leg, hit high on the pad, the ball rolls towards point
length ball is crisply driven towards mid-off by Amla
full and on the pads, clipped down towards fine leg
full and on the pads, tucked towards midwicket, played it in the air
length ball on middle and off, driven towards long-off for a single, South Africa having it too easy here, Australia need some Johnson magic
length ball from Faulkner, pushed back towards the bowler
on the pads, tucked behind square leg for another single

run-out? short of length ball outside off, Faf defends it towards cover point, another tight single attempted, direct hit from Maxwell, is Amla gone this time? Australia think so, but he has made it in, just in, Maxwell had to move a few yards to his left to collect the ball, provided the time for Amla to get in
drops the ball towards backward point, another quick single, less risky than the previous one
length ball from Lyon,round the wicket, turns in towards the pads, defended
tossed this one outside off, bit of air as well, punched towards extra cover
length ball on the stumps, Amla is quickly out of the crease and whips it flamboyantly towards midwicket, good running there
once more Amla takes a few strides down the track, tucks this towards mid-on, a diving stop from the bowler Lyon
fuller and on the pads, easy to deflect that towards square leg for a single
Faf gets on one knee and scoops this one towards short fine leg

Faf does what he has been doing all series, whacking the ball where he pleases, he skips down the pitch to get near the ball and effortlessly sends that soaring to the wide long-on boundary, 50 stand comes up, just missed the cameraman there by a yard
slower one and that is defended towards midwicket
off the leading edge as Faf is squared up, the ball dribbles towards cover for a single
full ball is defends towards cover
full ball is helped towards short fine leg for a single
short of length ball heading towards middle and leg, defended towards point
spinning in from round the wicket, Amla stays back as he defends
comes down the pitch this time and wristily works it towards square leg

ooh, for a change not off the middle of the bat from Faf, he was charging down the track and looking to whack that over mid-on, the ball turns plenty and nearly sneaked past, an edge, low on the bat says Faf
tucked towards midwicket, plenty of spin here for Lyon
flicked uppishly past Bailey at square leg
not the most elegant of strokes, Amla doesn't time it too well either as he slaps the ball towards mid-off
his first ball is punched towards cover for a single
short of a length, just outside off, Amla gets off his feet to get on top of the bounce, expertly controlled as he sends the ball towards third man
length ball is driven towards cover for a single
fired in towards the pads from round the wicket, eased towards midwicket for a single
flings this down the leg side, easy for Faf to guide this along to fine leg for four
short of a length ball and just outside off, stabbed towards backward point, straight at Maxwell
full and on the pads, clipped to square leg
length ball is eased towards midwicket for a single
goes for the scoop once more, not off the middle of the bat, the ball lobs up but lands safely near short fine leg
more spin for Lyon, Amla looks to defend off the front foot, thick inside edge to the leg side
on the pads once more, Amla charges out once more, tucks this to square leg
another edge, this one was the closest to a wicket, Amla was going to thrash that through the cover, bottom edge sends the ball past the stumps and the keeper, Lyon can't believe his luck
the batsmen living dangerously here, this delivery was well of the stumps, Faf plays it away from his body, nearly nicks it as the ball flies through to the keeper

dropped, but that is a tough chance for Finch, a length ball is launched over long-off, hit low on the bat and that goes high and not long enough, Finch has to sprint to get under that one, and it lands a yard beyond him
shortish ball on leg stump, defended to the leg side by Amla, who stands tall as he keeps that one out
short ball, quick short ball from Johnson, Amla spots it, arches his back as he gets safely under that one
well outside off, slower one, Amla allows it through to the keeper
defended to the leg side
length ball on the pads, blocked to the leg side once more
full ball is driven towards long-on for a single
Amla walks across the stumps, then guides the spinning ball towards fine leg
driven towards long-on for one more
turning down the leg side, no trouble for Amla as he guides that towards fine leg
short of length ball outside off as Mitchell Starc starts a new spell, pushed towards third man
full slower one on middle stump, eased towards mid-on
short of length and outside off, all too easy for South Africa, Faf taps this towards cover point to move to 40
there aren't likely to be in play if the ball is this short and wide, eased towards backward point
full ball angling in from round the wicket, another edge as Amla looks to drive, the ball hums towards third man
worked towards deep midwicket for a cuple
full ball on the pads, tucked in front of square leg for a single
worked towards long-on for one more
length ball, bit of flight there, solid forward defensive, not seen too many of that this innings
Amla skips down the track, whips the ball off his pads towards midwicket
more flight, this was full from Lyon, Faf swats that away towards midwicket, powerfully struck for four, Lyon has a rueful grin after that
more spin for Lyon, the ball turns past the stumps, helped past leg slip, 50 comes up once more for Faf
full and straight, Amla comes forward to defend
he leans forward and punches it back to the bowler
he flicks this through square leg for a single
no room there, the batsman defends it to the leg side
it's not really short but the batsman drags it along to deep midwicket with a cross-batted swipe
he hops in the crease and and whips it away behind square on the leg side to bring up his half-century. His 25th in ODIs
tossed up on off stump but Amla closes the face to push it to wide long on
gets some drift as he tosses it up, Faf calmly nudges it to midwicket for a single
massive spin! Amla was pushing at the leg break but this turns almost 90 degrees..
whoa!! What have you done Amla! It's a long hop wide outside off, short and spinning away, and all Amla can do is slap it straight to the hands of cover..Big big break for Australia
tossed up, Parnell watches it carefully, but this one doesn't spin at all, the batsman leaves it alone
he can bowl a googly too! Not much turn and Parnell defends it to off
fuller delivery, the batsman punches it down to long off for a single
back of length delivery on off, the batsman stays on the back foot and defends it to off
he stays back to the back of length delivery, defends it to off
bowls the cutter that is defended down the pitch
bowls the cutter around off stump, the batsman can only fend it towards midwicket
now the bumper, it sails over the batsman's head
short of length delivery on the stumps, slightly slower, allows the batsman to work it away to deep midwicket
he tosses it up on the stumps, Parnell is drawn in to a drive, pushes it to cover
lots of flight here, the batsman punches it firmly to short cover
turn and bounce! This one zips past the outside edge as the batsman goes fishing
he gets an outside edge towards point as he looks to defend off the front foot
he looks to flick this full delivery away to the leg side but gets a leading edge to cover
tossed up outside off, spins away, Parnell leaves it alone
slower delivery on off stump, Faf gives Parnell the strike with a dab to third man

loud appeal for lbw as the batsman doesn't offer a shot! Just hit outside the line of off. .The batsmen run a couple.. Umpire gives it leg byes.. but the batsman wasn't offering a shot there.. That was a decent shout actually.. it was heading towards the stumps
this is another good shout! The batsman was looking to punch it across the line and gets hit in front of the stumps.. where is it heading? Probably missing leg. Tell you what, this was very close
another shout of lbw.. third in a row, but there is a bit of inside edge this time
fuller delivery outside off, Parnell gets off strike with a punch to wide mid off
length delivery, the batsman punches it back down the pitch
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman defends solidly
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it again
finally gets some solid bat behind the ball, charges down the pitch and whacks it over mid-off for a one-bounce four
flighted delivery again, the batsman comes forward and defends
fuller this time on the stumps, the batsman punches it back down the pitch
lots of flight on this one, Parnell remains stuck, can only punch it back to the bowler
he comes to strike after a while and gets a boundary! That runs off the outside edge past the keeper.. He was aiming to glide it down to third man but gets bonus runs instead
back of length delivery on off, the batsman pushes it to point
he comes forward and punches the length delivery to midwicket. Bailey throws down the stumps at the non-striker's end and the batsmen take a single off the richochet

here it comes! After eating 24 balls, Parnell chops one on to his stumps. This darted in off the pitch and Parnell was stuck in the crease, brings his bat down a little late and doesn't cover the line.
angled it across the batsman and beats AB as he flashes the bat at that, stays a touch low too
brings this one back and it hits the batsman's pad, they take a leg bye as it rolls off the pads to the leg side
tosses it up and spins it further away, AB cuts it to deep point
he keeps his bat horizontal and paddles it down to fine leg in a premeditated manner
waits for the ball to turn away, then punches it to deep cover
top edge over the keeper's head! "catch it," says Haddin, but it's too far from the slip fielder running backwards. Faf was shaping to play the paddle there
he opens the stance and flat bats it to deep square leg, playing against the turn
tossed up outside off, Faf was planning to play the lap sweep, but changes it at the last moment to block it to off
length delivery outside off, AB dabs it behind point calmly for a single
he bowls a sharp bouncer, Faf confidently pulls it down to deep square leg
he shuffles across the stumps and flicks this length delivery fine on the leg side, and he is quick between the wickets, comes back for the second
the batsman waits in the crease and steers the length delivery down to third man
targets the stumps with a fuller length, the batsman defends it to midwicket
he squeezes it off the back foot past the diving cover fielder to keep the strike
he comes round the wicket and pounds it on short of length, the batsman defends it to cover easily
aims for the yorker that Faf digs out towards mid-on for a quick single
full and outside off, gives the batsman enough space to nudge it down to third man
another attempted yorker outside off but Faf squeezes it out past backward point for a quick couple
fuller delivery outside off, Faf drives it to deep cover
he charges down the pitch and hammers the length delivery over wide mid-on for a boundary
targets the head with a bumper that is pulled down to deep square leg comfortably, Faf rolling his wrists on it as he swivels
classy! He shuffles across and cuts the shorter delivery just in the right place, past backward point.. He did not hit it hard, just showed it the way and that runs away to the boundary
length delivery on off, the batsman pushes it to cover and calls for a quick single
more runs! This is beautifully punched past mid-off as an attempted yorker becomes a half-volley.. driven firmly down the ground
short delivery, the batsman pulls it down fine with a roll of wrists for a couple. The umpire, though, signals a short run
back of length delivery on the stumps, punched to midwicket
loud appeal for lbw as the batsman gets hit on the pads, but that was outside the line of off
looks to reverse sweep it but this is too full, he plays it softly towards first slip, who allows it to run through him
now wants to paddle this fine, but it's too fine.. Haddin's left leg prevents it from running away
he looks to flick it through the leg side but cannot beat backward square leg
goes down on the knee early and paddles it fine for a single
flatter on the stumps, the batsman looks to work it away to the leg side, but finds the man at midwicket
he delivers the back-of-the-hand slower ball, the batsman dabs it towards point for a single
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman nudges it calmly to the leg side for a single
fires in a good yorker on the base of the middle stump, the batsman digs it out to midwicket
it't the slower ball again, turns in like a chinaman, the batsman clips it down to fine leg for a single
bowls the slower bouncer! the batsman stays in the crease and slaps it down to fine leg for a single
fuller delivery on the stumps, the batsman digs it out to midwicket for a single
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman works it away through midwicket for a single
he looks to reverse sweep this but misses, loud appeal for lbw but this miles outside off stump
he comes down the pitch and defends this to midwicket
tossed up delivery on the stumps, AB calmly defends it to the leg side
he gets a bit of inside edge down to fine leg while he was actually looking to defend
flatter and quicker on off, the batsman defends it to the leg side
fires it full outside off and beats the bat as AB looks to guide it to third man
superb delivery! This comes in with the angle and leaves the batsman at the last moment.. beating the outside edge again
he comes down the pitch and slaps this length delivery through midwicket with disdain. No one really moves
fires in a yorker that is punched to the left of mid-on, the batsman scampers through for a quick one
this is a slower delivery on off and Faf takes it on the full to drill it down to long off
looks to come out of the crease but gets cramped for room, defends the length delivery to midwicket
tossed up outside off, wristily flicked to midwicket
tossed up on off, the batsman comes forward and defends
goes down on the knee early and paddles the fuller delivery to fine leg
floats this one up but gives away a lot of width there, AB drills it through cover with a powerful drive. There is no one behind the cover fielders.. that trickles to the boundary
steps out and punches the flatter delivery to long on
tossed up on the stumps, Faf flicks it fine to pick up a single
full ball is driven towards mid-off for a single
short of length ball on the pads, tucked behind the square leg
short of length ball outside off, guided towards backward point
on the pads, du Plessis clips the ball towards deep midwicket, charges back for the second
short and wide from round the wicket, slapped towards point, hit low on the bat as he played that one
pitched up, played uppishly towards deep point, bottom hand comes off the bat as he plays that
full ball is driven towards long-off for a single
short of length ball on off stump, eased towards long-off for an ambled single, South Africa ambling to the title here
slower one from over the wicket, back of the hand ball cuts in after pitching, even Faf in this form can't play that one properly
extra bounce from that slower one one from Faulkner, that is a good variation to have, defended towards midwicket
pitched up and that is worked towards deep midwicket for two
pitched up and outside off, driven towards short extra cover
slower one outside off, looked to guide it to third man but misses, the keeper fumbles as well
short of length ball angling in towards off stump, defended towards point
oh, that was comical, AB was dancing down the track, Johnson spots that and fires it full and wide, AB had to lunge across to reach it, gets it over cover
full ball on the stumps, tucked towards midwicket, all too easy this
full and outside off, bottom edge as AB looks to drive through covers
full back is tucked towards midwicket
outside off, guided towards backward point
length ball is clobbered into the crowd, that was pure disdain, skates down the track and smashes that over midwicket
what century for Faf? back to back sixes for AB, he thumps this one over long-off for another huge hit, stylish and authoritative
makes room and chops that through the covers for four more, fifty for AB
cutting in towards middle and leg, inside-edged onto the pads, a dot ball, and Faf will be on strike
four for Faf, he thrashes this over over mid-on for four, a flat-batted swat, he's on 96 now
full ball is driven towards long-off, the single is declined
is that a wide? is that a no-ball? the umpires confer after a high wide full toss outside, they decide it is a no-ball for height, don't think it should have been, scores level
Faf smiles after he can't connect properly with a totally wild slog, the ball rolls to the keeper

no century for Faf, he was losing his composure here as he needed a big shot to get his 100, he has lost his wicket now, a full toss is thrashed towards mid-on, hit high on the bat,else that was a four, end of a memorable series for Faf
AB finishes it off next ball, a full ball is thumped through cover for four, AB and JP hug in the middle, they have outclassed Australia today
